title: Premier Jacinta Allan booed at Bondi attack vigil | 7NEWS
description: Vigils were held across Australia to remember the 15 victims of the Bondi Beach attack. At a memorial service at Caulfield Hebrew Congregation in Melbourne, Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan was booed by approximately 1,000 attendees who expressed anger about anti-Semitism and feeling unsafe in the community. Extra security has been deployed around Melbourne, with ongoing patrols around schools and synagogues, while Jewish celebrations like Hanukkah continue with additional protection. title: NSW Health Minister Ryan Park provides update on casualties | 7NEWS
description: Twenty-six people remain hospitalised following the Bondi tragedy, with twelve in critical condition and three children in stable condition at Sydney Children's Hospital. New South Wales Health Minister Ryan Park reports that hospital staff across seven Sydney hospitals have worked to treat patients with severe injuries over a 36-hour period. The state's mass casualty response system successfully managed the emergency without requiring cancellation of elective surgeries. title: Australia's biggest blood drive since Black Saturday | 7NEWS
description: Australia has experienced its biggest blood donation response since the Black Saturday bushfires in 2009, with over 40,000 appointments booked within 24 hours following Lifeblood's urgent call for donors. The overwhelming response has seen people queuing for up to three hours outside donation centres, with support from public figures including cricket captain Pat Cummins and NSW Premier Chris Minns. title: Police charge son of Rob Reiner with his death
description: Nick Reiner, the 32-year-old son of Rob Reiner, has been arrested on homicide charges after the filmmaker and his wife were found dead in their Los Angeles home. #robreiner #police #losangeles #la #lapd

title: McLeod's Daughters star passes away aged 45
description: McLeod's Daughters star Rachel Carpani has died aged 45 after a battle with chronic illness. #mcleodsdaughters #rachelcarpani #actor #chronicillness #vale

title: Security ramped up after Bondi terror attack following shooters links to ISIS | 7NEWS
description: Former police officials and security experts discuss public safety concerns following the Bondi terror attack, with Christmas events approaching. Authorities are ramping up security operations including Operation Shelter in New South Wales, deploying hundreds of additional officers to protect major events like Carols in the Domain and the Boxing Day Test. Questions are being raised about gun licensing processes after revelations that one of the attackers had legal access to high-powered weapons despite previous ASIO attention. title: Qld researchers find COVID alters brain tissue
description: Researchers from Griffith University have found that COVID-19 can cause long-term brain alterations in those who had been infected. #covid #brain #reasearch #griffithuniversity #queensland

title: Bondi terrorist was known to ASIO authorities | 7NEWS
description: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke confirms that 24-year-old Bondi terrorist Naveed Akram was known to ASIO authorities over five years ago through his association with an ISIS terror cell in Sydney in 2019. Burke explains that while Akram was within ASIO's scope due to his associations, he did not display the violent ideology or motivation at that time that he later developed. The Australian Federal Police continue their criminal investigation as part of the joint counter-terrorism team response. title: New footage of elderly man attempting to stop shooters surfaces | 7NEWS
description: Newly surfaced footage appears to show a bystander, who was later shot, attempting to disarm one of the alleged Bondi Beach attackers moments before he reached the footbridge.  Naveed Akram, 24, and his father Sajid Akram, 50, allegedly opened fire on people gathered for the Chanukah by the Sea event, marking the first night of Hanukkah, at Bondi about 6.40pm on Sunday. title: More than 50,000 blood donations made a day after Bondi beach attack
description: As the nation reeled over the second-worst mass shooting in Australian history, many people looked at what they could do to help those who were caught up in the terror attack at Bondi. With at least many people still in hospital, Lifeblood made an urgent call for blood donors.  On Monday, more than 50,000 appointments were booked in 24 hours, double the previous record. #lifeblood #donation #bondibeach #bondi #Sydney

title: Sydney terror attack sparks major event security fears | 7NEWS
description: A terror attack in Sydney has prompted serious security concerns for upcoming major events including Carols in the Domain, Ashes cricket test matches, and New Year's Eve fireworks. Waverley Council has cancelled all upcoming Hanukkah events following the Bondi attack, while the City of Sydney indicates potential amendments to Christmas programs. Security experts emphasise the need for heightened vigilance at mass public events and reporting suspicious behaviour. title: Bondi Beach shooting: New vision shows bystander confronting alleged gunman before he reached bridge
description: Newly surfaced dashcam video appears to show a bystander, who was later shot, attempting to disarm one of the alleged Bondi Beach attackers moments before he reached the footbridge during Sunday evening's terror attack.  If you need help in a crisis, call Lifeline on 13 11 14. title: PM meets Bondi Beach hero in hospital
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has visited Bondi Beach hero Ahmed al Ahmed in hospital. Posting to social media the PM wrote: "Ahmed, you are an Australian hero. You put yourself at risk to save others, running towards danger on Bondi Beach and disarming a terrorist. On behalf of every Australian, I say thank you."  The gunman-tackling hero wounded in the Bondi massacre spoke earlier from hospital, expressing his medical hardships and asked his mother to pray for him. Ahmed al Ahmed spoke in Arabic as he wished good health on his well-wishers in the video translated and shared on social media by Turkish news agency TRT World. â€œI ask my mother, the apple of my eye, pray for me. Pray for me, my mother,â€ he said. "God willing, it will be a minor injury.â€ #bondi #bondibeach #bondihero #AnthonyAlbanese #Sydney
